## Validate.isValidConditionKey() function

Determines whether a string is a valid condition key. A condition key has the format: `<qualifierName>(-<operator>)?-[<value>]@<priority>` where operator is omitted for the default 'matches' operator.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function isValidConditionKey(key: string): key is ConditionKey;
```

</th><th>

</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

key


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

the string to validate


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

key is [ConditionKey](./ts-res.conditionkey.md)

`true` if the string is a valid condition key, `false` otherwise.
